intro: Eubotryoides grayana var. oblongifolia, commonly known as the broad-leafed eubotryoides, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves that are often glabrous and have a smooth texture. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with showy petals that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland forests or along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an attractive species for both ornamental and ecological purposes.
